data.content:
noun
plural -nies
[noncount] :the use of words that mean the opposite of what you really think especially in order to be funny
a writer known for her clever use of irony
What a beautiful view, he said, his voice dripping with irony, as he looked out the window at the alley.
She described her vacation with heavy irony as an educational experience. - compare sarcasm
a situation that is strange or funny because things happen in a way that seems to be the opposite of what you expected [count]
It was a tragic irony that he made himself sick by worrying so much about his health.
The (awful/bitter) irony is that in trying to forget her, he thought of her even more.
That's just one of life's little ironies. [noncount]
The irony of the situation was apparent to everyone.
He has a strong sense of irony.

Danh từ
sự mỉa mai, châm biếm
điều trớ trêu
the irony of fate
điều trớ trêu của số mệnh
